title: NASA Upbeat About Future of Mars Sample Return Despite IRB-2 Report
summary: NASA may have received discouraging news from a recent independent review of the Mars Sample Return mission, but key NASA officials and members of the space science community remain upbeat […]

title: Upgraded star trackers could give more satellites a debris-monitoring role
summary: New star-tracking sensors in the works would enable all manner of satellites to keep an eye out for hazardous orbital debris too small to detect from the ground.

title: ISS Roundup: Expedition 70 underway, Rubio’s record stay in space, technical issues, upcoming EVAs
summary: The last few months aboard the International Space Station (ISS) have been eventful. Expedition 70 is underway after two crew handovers, a bearing on a solar array rotary joint seized up, and a coolant leak on the Russian segment occurred. Currently, the ISS crew is preparing for Russian EVA-61 and US EVA-89 later this month.

title: PLD Space calls first launch a success
summary: Spanish launch vehicle startup PLD Space declared their first suborbital launch a success, clearing the way for development of an orbital launch vehicle.

title: Space Development Agency awards York Space $615 million contract for 62 satellites
summary: The Space Development Agency has awarded York Space a $615 million contract for 62 satellites for DoD’s low Earth orbit constellation.
